metadata.dc:author: Poch Broto, J
Pérez Carretero, M
Vilas Díaz, M R
metadata.dc:description: Fourteen patients with bilateral laryngeal paralysis in adduction were studied. Six of these patients were treated by arytenoidopexy and chordopexy, and the other 8 underwent endoscopic CO2 laser endoscopy. After comparison of the two groups we concluded that the latter technique yielded better respiratory and phonatory results than others previously used.
metadata.dc:title: Parálisis laríngeas bilaterales en adducción: aspectos terapéuticos.
[Bilateral laryngeal paralysis in adduction: therapeutic aspects].
